bibl.title: Sophocles' Ichneutai 176-202: A Lyric Dialogue (?) Featuring an Impressive Mimetic Scene.
bibl.note: The papyrus [P. Oxy. IX, 1174 + XVII, 2081(a) (= M.-P.3 1473; LDAB 3929)] assigns vv. 176-202 to the Chorus of Satyrs, but this is probably a lyric dialogue between the Chorus and Silenos, who is leading and instructing the Satyrs for the tracking of the stolen cows. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Andreas P. Antonopoulos, Sophocles' Ichneutai 176-202: A Lyric Dialogue (?) Featuring an Impressive Mimetic Scene.

The papyrus [P. Oxy. IX, 1174 + XVII, 2081(a) (= M.-P.3 1473; LDAB 3929)] assigns vv. 176-202 to the Chorus of Satyrs, but this is probably a lyric dialogue between the Chorus and Silenos, who is leading and instructing the Satyrs for the tracking of the stolen cows. - Avec résumé en anglais.
